40582497.review:
Quanero ist eine VR-Erfahrung, die tolle Möglichkeiten aufzeigt. (getestet mit der HTC Vive)
Unsere Aufgabe ist es herauszufinden, warum eine futuristische Bar in die Luft geflogen ist.
Dazu begeben wir uns mitten ins Geschehen und können beobachten, was vor sich ging. Das Tolle daran, wir können uns die Szene in der Bar aus jeder Perspektive zu jedem Zeitpunkt der Explosion anschauen, indem wir die Zeit vor und zurüchspulen.
Das funktioniert dermaßen gut, dass man sich ein ganzen Spiel mit dieser Technik wünschen würde.
Die Grafik sieht recht gut aus und läuft mit einer GTX 970 flüssig. Die Szene in Zeitlupe abzuspielen und anzuhalten, um wirklich jede Perspektive unter die Lupe zu nehmen, ist einfach klasse umgesetzt.
Auf jeden Fall mal anschauen, da es gratis ist. Es ist ein tolles Erlebnis und macht lust auf mehr.
Gruß Ziffi

39152920.review:
[h1]Great concept, middling execution, still worth it[/h1]

In Quanero, a slice of spacetime has been preserved for you to observe. An accident has taken place at a futuristic bar, and you can shift back and forth in time and move around among the characters to watch the events unfold in any way you want.

I really like this concept. It's passive, and there's no real reason why it should be in VR, but it does feel much more immersive viewing the events in first person when you're in VR. It feels like those new theatre experiences popping around that let you move around among the actors and go from room to room watching the play unfold.

The intro makes it sound like like you're an investigator and you're supposed to solve the mystery of how the accident happened. The truth is that there's no interactive element here. You're not solving anything, you're just watching a series of events from a variety of starting points.

The short story that takes place isn't much, it doesn't really make sense and is very unbelievable (four stories are taking place at once and they all culminate in the same instant), the character animation and voice acting are nothing impressive, and the winding of time back and forth can be tedious because you can't speed it up past 1x. This was made with Unreal VR and it looks very blurry.

I still enjoyed it. It's worth experiencing once, just to admire the concept and think of how it can be further developed by other teams. I think Quanero was a university project, and in that perspective I find it impressive.

The concept of this game has scope to be massive and extremely popular. The feeling of being in control, go back and forward in time and able to move about was incredibly satisfying. It felt voyeuristic and games following this concept could be sexy or scary or heart pounding depending on the quality of the content.

There are lots of VR titles where you can just sit about not able to do much but appreciate the scene. This does all that but adds story, ability to move about, look around from different locations, and control time. I'd love to see more of this on a bigger scale. For example, a story around theatre or musicals - watching a show on and offstage with things happening at different times. Being able to go into different rooms and views from the curtains and stage and audience as the show takes place. 26552002.review:
Played on Oculus Rift:

I was quite impressed with this 'demo' game, from a seemingly small developer/team.
It roughly reminded me of the time manipulation in "Remember Me" except without the hand-holding highlighting of objects.

Pros:
-Well thought-out environment.
-Story and concept is interesting.
-It's good to see some slightly more mature content in VR (swearing and violent themes), after playing Family-Rated Luckey's Tale, among others.
-Time manipulation is a great use of VR tech.
-Audio and audio positioning in-game is very effective and well done.
-Controls work great - wouldn't improve on any part of this (except maybe with Touch implementation).
-Absolutely loved how I could lean down to actually read the small print on the character's tablet/clipboard in the game (until my Rift bumped into my keyboard).

Cons:
-Dev needs more funding/time to better polish textures and modelling.
-Game objectives aren't necessarily clear (unlocking sections of the memory?).
-The voice acting accents are interesting but require extra attention at times for a native English speaker from the US (not so much a con, I suppose).
-Could use some GFX settings to cater to various levels of hardware ability.
-Not quite sure what, but it needs some game elements to add replayability.

Basically, I highly recommend this as yet another (fun and interesting) VR experience with interactive elements. I think that there is a ton of potential here for this concept to grow into something bigger, and I would definitely pay a reasonable price for a bigger and more-developed experience. Looking forward to more!!

25680757.review:
I wasn't quite sure what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised.  The concept of the game revolves around the control of time to view a scene from multiple perspectives.  The player is just a ghost in the scene that can't interact with anything, but your goal is just to observe.  The closer you observe, the more you will get out of the game because attention to detail is pretty high.  Even though the game only technically consists of one room, since there are five distinct interactions going on at the same time, the amount of content will last you at least 30 to 45 minutes.  You can't really "win" at the game in any sense.  You just get the personal satisfaction of fully understanding what was going down.  

To the devs, I'd suggest the addition of a time-slider for rewinding and fast forwarding of the scene to a specific point.  Often times, you have to watch the scene unfold from one perspective for a minute or two, then wait a minute or two while you are reversing time back to the start to see the scene from a different perspective.  If not a time slider, than at least 2x or 4x speed.  I'd instantly buy a full version of this game if it ever comes out.

Very nice little project.
I don't know if this was a proof of concept or if this is all there is to it.
If it's the former, then great, if it's the latter then that is disappointing because what is shown here is interesting and has tons of promise.

It's clearly not a game though, as there is no interaction on on the player's part beyond playing or rewinding the sequence. In that regard is has more in common with VR animations such as [i]The Rose and I[/i].
More than just a glorified 360° video though, [i]Quanero[/i] is basically everything I'd want from a true VR movie-like experience.

I can only hope someone with a large budget and a sizeable production machine behind them will see [i]Quanero[/i] and recognize the potential that lies within VR as a medium - so that we may one day have full-fledged features presented like this.

I dearly hope this genre takes off! Sure, the voice acting and animations are nothing to write home about, but this is a brilliant introduction to a brand new form of interactive storytelling.

Someone please make a version of Clue like this!

25062509.review:
Brilliant concept for a VR experience! Short to play through, but is very engaging to watch all the mini stories from different perspectives and piece together the whole sequence of events. 

The overall scene is well thought out for this short experience, and does require you to go through it forward and backward from different angles to catch the details and understand the whole picture.

As others have said the modelling and voice acting are not the greatest, but they certainly get the job done and the design overall is superb for 20 weeks of work.

Check this out if you're a new Vive owner and craving content while your wallet is recovering.

蓝机灵男人刷ipad，发现左边的大哥是个通缉犯，于是上前殴打，殴打的同时爆炸了。是这个通缉犯引爆的？

24948087.review:
A short but rewarding experience in which you control time but none of the action. Does that make it sound boring? It's not! I opened it up thinking it wouldn't really be my thing, but good voice work, writing, and animation left me pleasantly surprised, and I've found myself recommending it to friends.

For future episodes/expansions, I'd encourage the developers to include more content that doesn't involve people murdering each other. I was more interested in the lovers' quarrel on the balcony than I was in the junkie executing people in the bar not because I have a moral issue with that content, but because the back-and-forth naturalistic dialogue was genuinely funny. Your story-telling skills are obviously excellent; please don't  dress ALL of it up in violence.

整个事件发生的过程，可以前进或者后退，或者暂停

大约需要找出10多个细节线索，我还差两个。这些细节，必须要瞬移到具体的位置，观察发生过程，才能发现
比如：烤肉的老头踢爆瓦斯罐爆炸了，吧一对那女其中女的，挂在了塌陷的地板上，男的想踩她，后来又拉起来了
另外一个男人，发现邻桌是个通缉犯吧，然后就开始打架
里面有一桌台球俩人，被自动的机器人碰到了脚，把白球打到了对方的头上，导致摔倒，撞到了另外交谈的俩人
俩人之一被碰撞后，掉出了警徽，结果对方就抽枪了
这些细节被你逐个发现后，就会存档一个照片。
大约一共10个细节。我还差2
需要不停的回放，前进。谁玩明白了，留言告诉我吧

I have to say this is another VR title that has great promise and I hope it doesn't get shelved and filed as just another tech demo. This to me seems like a futuristic investigation game where you use time controlled features to find clues and figure out a conclusion to your case. The premise is very good for a VR game and being in a 360 degree 3D world just makes it even better. The graphics are a little blurred but look good enough to be enjoyable. The characters look like clay but that is also something that can be over looked right now. I am sure if this does get made into a real game then the devs will work on polishing up the graphics a bit. Try this out. You will surely like the short experience. I went through the scenario several times at many angles and locations in the setting.  Devs: Make this one a winner for us VR users. Please? Steam you got the money. Make it so !!! 10/10 for the idea and effort.

Es laufen mehrere Handlungsstränge ab und auf den ersten Blick ist gar nicht so klar, wieso passiert ist, was passiert ist.
